ANU.name: Katharina Freund
expertise: Teacher Education And Professional Development Of Educators
Communication Technology And Digital Media Studies
interest: Katie is a researcher in education technology, higher education and professional learning, and learning design. She also researches fan studies, digital communication, and social media from a cultural studies perspective.Unfortunately, Katie is not able to offer supervision to any prospective research students at this time.
ANU.biography: Katie is now the Technology-Enhanced Learning and Teaching (TELT) Manager for the ANU Medical School, where she leads a team of learning designers and technologists to create online resources, manage education technologies, and provide learning design advice for the School.
project: Katie's current research interests include the use of social media in teaching, professional learning in higher education, and blended learning designs.

publication.title: Fair use is legal use": Copyright negotiations and strategies in the fan-vidding community
publication.source: New Media and Society, vol. 18, no. 7, pp. 1347-1363

publication.title: Collective effervescence: Designing MOOCs for emotion and community

publication.source: Rhetoric and Reality: Critical perspectives on educational technology, ed. B Hegarty, J McDonald, SK Loke, ASCILITE: Australasian Society for Computers in Learning in Tertiary Education, Dunedin New Zealand, pp. 643-648
